00070 struct btClockData
00071 {
00072 
00073 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00074         LARGE_INTEGER mClockFrequency;
00075         LONGLONG mStartTick;
00076         LARGE_INTEGER mStartTime;
00077 #else
00078 #ifdef __CELLOS_LV2__
00079         uint64_t        mStartTime;
00080 #else
00081 #ifdef __APPLE__
00082     uint64_t mStartTimeNano;
00083 #endif
00084         struct timeval mStartTime;
00085 #endif
00086 #endif //__CELLOS_LV2__
00087 
00088 };

00091 btClock::btClock()
00092 {
00093         m_data = new btClockData;
00094 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00095         QueryPerformanceFrequency(&m_data->mClockFrequency);
00096 #endif
00097         reset();
00098 }
00099 
00100 btClock::~btClock()
00101 {
00102         delete m_data;
00103 }
00104 
00105 btClock::btClock(const btClock& other)
00106 {
00107         m_data = new btClockData;
00108         *m_data = *other.m_data;
00109 }
00110 
00111 btClock& btClock::operator=(const btClock& other)
00112 {
00113         *m_data = *other.m_data;
00114         return *this;
00115 }

00117 
00119 void btClock::reset()
00120 {
00121 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00122         QueryPerformanceCounter(&m_data->mStartTime);
00123         m_data->mStartTick = GetTickCount64();
00124 #else
00125 #ifdef __CELLOS_LV2__
00126 
00127         typedef uint64_t  ClockSize;
00128         ClockSize newTime;
00129         //__asm __volatile__( "mftb %0" : "=r" (newTime) : : "memory");
00130         SYS_TIMEBASE_GET( newTime );
00131         m_data->mStartTime = newTime;
00132 #else
00133 #ifdef __APPLE__
00134     m_data->mStartTimeNano = mach_absolute_time();
00135 #endif
00136         gettimeofday(&m_data->mStartTime, 0);
00137 #endif
00138 #endif
00139 }
00140 
00143 unsigned long long int btClock::getTimeMilliseconds()
00144 {
00145 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00146         LARGE_INTEGER currentTime;
00147         QueryPerformanceCounter(&currentTime);
00148         LONGLONG elapsedTime = currentTime.QuadPart -
00149                 m_data->mStartTime.QuadPart;
00150                 // Compute the number of millisecond ticks elapsed.
00151         unsigned long msecTicks = (unsigned long)(1000 * elapsedTime /
00152                 m_data->mClockFrequency.QuadPart);
00153 
00154                 return msecTicks;
00155 #else
00156 
00157 #ifdef __CELLOS_LV2__
00158                 uint64_t freq=sys_time_get_timebase_frequency();
00159                 double dFreq=((double) freq) / 1000.0;
00160                 typedef uint64_t  ClockSize;
00161                 ClockSize newTime;
00162                 SYS_TIMEBASE_GET( newTime );
00163                 //__asm __volatile__( "mftb %0" : "=r" (newTime) : : "memory");
00164 
00165                 return (unsigned long int)((double(newTime-m_data->mStartTime)) / dFreq);
00166 #else
00167 
00168                 struct timeval currentTime;
00169                 gettimeofday(&currentTime, 0);
00170                 return (currentTime.tv_sec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_sec) * 1000 +
00171                         (currentTime.tv_usec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_usec) / 1000;
00172 #endif //__CELLOS_LV2__
00173 #endif
00174 }
00175 
00178 unsigned long long int btClock::getTimeMicroseconds()
00179 {
00180 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00181         //see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn553408(v=vs.85).aspx   
00182                 LARGE_INTEGER currentTime, elapsedTime;
00183                 
00184                 QueryPerformanceCounter(&currentTime);
00185                 elapsedTime.QuadPart = currentTime.QuadPart - 
00186                         m_data->mStartTime.QuadPart;
00187                 elapsedTime.QuadPart *= 1000000;
00188                 elapsedTime.QuadPart /= m_data->mClockFrequency.QuadPart;
00189 
00190                 return (unsigned long long) elapsedTime.QuadPart;
00191 #else
00192 
00193 #ifdef __CELLOS_LV2__
00194                 uint64_t freq=sys_time_get_timebase_frequency();
00195                 double dFreq=((double) freq)/ 1000000.0;
00196                 typedef uint64_t  ClockSize;
00197                 ClockSize newTime;
00198                 //__asm __volatile__( "mftb %0" : "=r" (newTime) : : "memory");
00199                 SYS_TIMEBASE_GET( newTime );
00200 
00201                 return (unsigned long int)((double(newTime-m_data->mStartTime)) / dFreq);
00202 #else
00203 
00204                 struct timeval currentTime;
00205                 gettimeofday(&currentTime, 0);
00206                 return (currentTime.tv_sec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_sec) * 1000000 +
00207                         (currentTime.tv_usec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_usec);
00208 #endif//__CELLOS_LV2__
00209 #endif
00210 }
00211 
00212 unsigned long long int btClock::getTimeNanoseconds()
00213 {
00214 #ifdef BT_USE_WINDOWS_TIMERS
00215         //see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn553408(v=vs.85).aspx
00216                 LARGE_INTEGER currentTime, elapsedTime;
00217                 
00218                 QueryPerformanceCounter(&currentTime);
00219                 elapsedTime.QuadPart = currentTime.QuadPart - 
00220                         m_data->mStartTime.QuadPart;
00221                 elapsedTime.QuadPart *= 1000000000;
00222                 elapsedTime.QuadPart /= m_data->mClockFrequency.QuadPart;
00223 
00224                 return (unsigned long long) elapsedTime.QuadPart;
00225 #else
00226 
00227 #ifdef __CELLOS_LV2__
00228                 uint64_t freq=sys_time_get_timebase_frequency();
00229                 double dFreq=((double) freq)/ 1e9;
00230                 typedef uint64_t  ClockSize;
00231                 ClockSize newTime;
00232                 //__asm __volatile__( "mftb %0" : "=r" (newTime) : : "memory");
00233                 SYS_TIMEBASE_GET( newTime );
00234 
00235                 return (unsigned long int)((double(newTime-m_data->mStartTime)) / dFreq);
00236 #else
00237 #ifdef __APPLE__
00238     uint64_t ticks = mach_absolute_time() - m_data->mStartTimeNano;
00239     static long double conversion = 0.0L;
00240     if( 0.0L == conversion )
00241     {
00242         // attempt to get conversion to nanoseconds
00243         mach_timebase_info_data_t info;
00244         int err = mach_timebase_info( &info );
00245         if( err )
00246         {
00247             btAssert(0);
00248             conversion = 1.;
00249         }
00250         conversion = info.numer / info.denom;
00251     }
00252     return (ticks * conversion);
00253 
00254     
00255 #else//__APPLE__
00256     
00257 #ifdef BT_LINUX_REALTIME
00258     timespec ts;
00259     clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME,&ts);
00260     return 1000000000*ts.tv_sec + ts.tv_nsec;
00261 #else
00262         struct timeval currentTime;
00263                 gettimeofday(&currentTime, 0);
00264                 return (currentTime.tv_sec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_sec) * 1e9 +
00265                         (currentTime.tv_usec - m_data->mStartTime.tv_usec)*1000;
00266 #endif //BT_LINUX_REALTIME
00267 
00268 #endif//__APPLE__
00269 #endif//__CELLOS_LV2__
00270 #endif 
00271 }
00272 
00273 
00276 btScalar btClock::getTimeSeconds()
00277 {
00278         static const btScalar microseconds_to_seconds = btScalar(0.000001);
00279         return btScalar(getTimeMicroseconds()) * microseconds_to_seconds;
00280 }

00288 inline void Profile_Get_Ticks(unsigned long int * ticks)
00289 {
00290         *ticks = (unsigned long int)gProfileClock.getTimeMicroseconds();
00291 }
00292 
00293 inline float Profile_Get_Tick_Rate(void)
00294 {
00295 //      return 1000000.f;
00296         return 1000.f;
00297 
00298 }

00301 /***************************************************************************************************
00302 **
00303 ** CProfileNode
00304 **
00305 ***************************************************************************************************/
00306 
00307 /***********************************************************************************************
00308  * INPUT:                                                                                      *
00309  * name - pointer to a static string which is the name of this profile node                    *
00310  * parent - parent pointer                                                                     *
00311  *                                                                                             *
00312  * WARNINGS:                                                                                   *
00313  * The name is assumed to be a static pointer, only the pointer is stored and compared for     *
00314  * efficiency reasons.                                                                         *
00315  *=============================================================================================*/
00316 CProfileNode::CProfileNode( const char * name, CProfileNode * parent ) :
00317         Name( name ),
00318         TotalCalls( 0 ),
00319         TotalTime( 0 ),
00320         StartTime( 0 ),
00321         RecursionCounter( 0 ),
00322         Parent( parent ),
00323         Child( NULL ),
00324         Sibling( NULL ),
00325         m_userPtr(0)
00326 {
00327         Reset();
00328 }
00329 
00330 
00331 void    CProfileNode::CleanupMemory()
00332 {
00333         delete ( Child);
00334         Child = NULL;
00335         delete ( Sibling);
00336         Sibling = NULL;
00337 }
00338 
00339 CProfileNode::~CProfileNode( void )
00340 {
00341         CleanupMemory();
00342 }
00343 
00344 
00345 /***********************************************************************************************
00346  * INPUT:                                                                                      *
00347  * name - static string pointer to the name of the node we are searching for                   *
00348  *                                                                                             *
00349  * WARNINGS:                                                                                   *
00350  * All profile names are assumed to be static strings so this function uses pointer compares   *
00351  * to find the named node.                                                                     *
00352  *=============================================================================================*/
00353 CProfileNode * CProfileNode::Get_Sub_Node( const char * name )
00354 {
00355         // Try to find this sub node
00356         CProfileNode * child = Child;
00357         while ( child ) {
00358                 if ( child->Name == name ) {
00359                         return child;
00360                 }
00361                 child = child->Sibling;
00362         }
00363 
00364         // We didn't find it, so add it
00365 
00366         CProfileNode * node = new CProfileNode( name, this );
00367         node->Sibling = Child;
00368         Child = node;
00369         return node;
00370 }
00371 
00372 
00373 void    CProfileNode::Reset( void )
00374 {
00375         TotalCalls = 0;
00376         TotalTime = 0.0f;
00377 
00378 
00379         if ( Child ) {
00380                 Child->Reset();
00381         }
00382         if ( Sibling ) {
00383                 Sibling->Reset();
00384         }
00385 }
00386 
00387 
00388 void    CProfileNode::Call( void )
00389 {
00390         TotalCalls++;
00391         if (RecursionCounter++ == 0) {
00392                 Profile_Get_Ticks(&StartTime);
00393         }
00394 }
00395 
00396 
00397 bool    CProfileNode::Return( void )
00398 {
00399         if ( --RecursionCounter == 0 && TotalCalls != 0 ) {
00400                 unsigned long int time;
00401                 Profile_Get_Ticks(&time);
00402 
00403                 time-=StartTime;
00404                 TotalTime += (float)time / Profile_Get_Tick_Rate();
00405         }
00406         return ( RecursionCounter == 0 );
00407 }

00410 /***************************************************************************************************
00411 **
00412 ** CProfileIterator
00413 **
00414 ***************************************************************************************************/
00415 CProfileIterator::CProfileIterator( CProfileNode * start )
00416 {
00417         CurrentParent = start;
00418         CurrentChild = CurrentParent->Get_Child();
00419 }
00420 
00421 
00422 void    CProfileIterator::First(void)
00423 {
00424         CurrentChild = CurrentParent->Get_Child();
00425 }
00426 
00427 
00428 void    CProfileIterator::Next(void)
00429 {
00430         CurrentChild = CurrentChild->Get_Sibling();
00431 }
00432 
00433 
00434 bool    CProfileIterator::Is_Done(void)
00435 {
00436         return CurrentChild == NULL;
00437 }
00438 
00439 
00440 void    CProfileIterator::Enter_Child( int index )
00441 {
00442         CurrentChild = CurrentParent->Get_Child();
00443         while ( (CurrentChild != NULL) && (index != 0) ) {
00444                 index--;
00445                 CurrentChild = CurrentChild->Get_Sibling();
00446         }
00447 
00448         if ( CurrentChild != NULL ) {
00449                 CurrentParent = CurrentChild;
00450                 CurrentChild = CurrentParent->Get_Child();
00451         }
00452 }
00453 
00454 
00455 void    CProfileIterator::Enter_Parent( void )
00456 {
00457         if ( CurrentParent->Get_Parent() != NULL ) {
00458                 CurrentParent = CurrentParent->Get_Parent();
00459         }
00460         CurrentChild = CurrentParent->Get_Child();
00461 }

00514 int                             CProfileManager::FrameCounter = 0;
00515 unsigned long int                       CProfileManager::ResetTime = 0;
00516 
00517 CProfileIterator *      CProfileManager::Get_Iterator( void )
00518 { 
00519 
00520                 int threadIndex = btQuickprofGetCurrentThreadIndex2();
00521                 if ((threadIndex<0) || threadIndex >= BT_QUICKPROF_MAX_THREAD_COUNT)
00522                         return 0;
00523 
00524                 return new CProfileIterator( &gRoots[threadIndex]); 
00525 }
00526 
00527 void                                            CProfileManager::CleanupMemory(void)
00528 {
00529         for (int i=0;i<BT_QUICKPROF_MAX_THREAD_COUNT;i++)
00530         {
00531                 gRoots[i].CleanupMemory();
00532         }
00533 }

00535 
00536 /***********************************************************************************************
00537  * CProfileManager::Start_Profile -- Begin a named profile                                    *
00538  *                                                                                             *
00539  * Steps one level deeper into the tree, if a child already exists with the specified name     *
00540  * then it accumulates the profiling; otherwise a new child node is added to the profile tree. *
00541  *                                                                                             *
00542  * INPUT:                                                                                      *
00543  * name - name of this profiling record                                                        *
00544  *                                                                                             *
00545  * WARNINGS:                                                                                   *
00546  * The string used is assumed to be a static string; pointer compares are used throughout      *
00547  * the profiling code for efficiency.                                                          *
00548  *=============================================================================================*/
00549 void    CProfileManager::Start_Profile( const char * name )
00550 {
00551         int threadIndex = btQuickprofGetCurrentThreadIndex2();
00552         if ((threadIndex<0) || threadIndex >= BT_QUICKPROF_MAX_THREAD_COUNT)
00553                 return;
00554 
00555         if (name != gCurrentNodes[threadIndex]->Get_Name()) {
00556                 gCurrentNodes[threadIndex] = gCurrentNodes[threadIndex]->Get_Sub_Node( name );
00557         }
00558 
00559         gCurrentNodes[threadIndex]->Call();
00560 }
00561 
00562 
00563 /***********************************************************************************************
00564  * CProfileManager::Stop_Profile -- Stop timing and record the results.                       *
00565  *=============================================================================================*/
00566 void    CProfileManager::Stop_Profile( void )
00567 {
00568         int threadIndex = btQuickprofGetCurrentThreadIndex2();
00569         if ((threadIndex<0) || threadIndex >= BT_QUICKPROF_MAX_THREAD_COUNT)
00570                 return;
00571 
00572         // Return will indicate whether we should back up to our parent (we may
00573         // be profiling a recursive function)
00574         if (gCurrentNodes[threadIndex]->Return()) {
00575                 gCurrentNodes[threadIndex] = gCurrentNodes[threadIndex]->Get_Parent();
00576         }
00577 }
00578 
00579 
00580 
00581 
00582 
00583 
00584 /***********************************************************************************************
00585  * CProfileManager::Reset -- Reset the contents of the profiling system                       *
00586  *                                                                                             *
00587  *    This resets everything except for the tree structure.  All of the timing data is reset.  *
00588  *=============================================================================================*/
00589 void    CProfileManager::Reset( void )
00590 {
00591         gProfileClock.reset();
00592         int threadIndex = btQuickprofGetCurrentThreadIndex2();
00593         if ((threadIndex<0) || threadIndex >= BT_QUICKPROF_MAX_THREAD_COUNT)
00594                 return;
00595         gRoots[threadIndex].Reset();
00596         gRoots[threadIndex].Call();
00597         FrameCounter = 0;
00598         Profile_Get_Ticks(&ResetTime);
00599 }
00600 
00601 
00602 /***********************************************************************************************
00603  * CProfileManager::Increment_Frame_Counter -- Increment the frame counter                    *
00604  *=============================================================================================*/
00605 void CProfileManager::Increment_Frame_Counter( void )
00606 {
00607         FrameCounter++;
00608 }
00609 
00610 
00611 /***********************************************************************************************
00612  * CProfileManager::Get_Time_Since_Reset -- returns the elapsed time since last reset         *
00613  *=============================================================================================*/
00614 float CProfileManager::Get_Time_Since_Reset( void )
00615 {
00616         unsigned long int time;
00617         Profile_Get_Ticks(&time);
00618         time -= ResetTime;
00619         return (float)time / Profile_Get_Tick_Rate();
00620 }
00621 
00622 #include <stdio.h>
00623 
00624 void    CProfileManager::dumpRecursive(CProfileIterator* profileIterator, int spacing)
00625 {
00626         profileIterator->First();
00627         if (profileIterator->Is_Done())
00628                 return;
00629 
00630         float accumulated_time=0,parent_time = profileIterator->Is_Root() ? CProfileManager::Get_Time_Since_Reset() : profileIterator->Get_Current_Parent_Total_Time();
00631         int i;
00632         int frames_since_reset = CProfileManager::Get_Frame_Count_Since_Reset();
00633         for (i=0;i<spacing;i++) printf(".");
00634         printf("----------------------------------\n");
00635         for (i=0;i<spacing;i++) printf(".");
00636         printf("Profiling: %s (total running time: %.3f ms) ---\n",     profileIterator->Get_Current_Parent_Name(), parent_time );
00637         float totalTime = 0.f;
00638 
00639 
00640         int numChildren = 0;
00641 
00642         for (i = 0; !profileIterator->Is_Done(); i++,profileIterator->Next())
00643         {
00644                 numChildren++;
00645                 float current_total_time = profileIterator->Get_Current_Total_Time();
00646                 accumulated_time += current_total_time;
00647                 float fraction = parent_time > SIMD_EPSILON ? (current_total_time / parent_time) * 100 : 0.f;
00648                 {
00649                         int i;  for (i=0;i<spacing;i++) printf(".");
00650                 }
00651                 printf("%d -- %s (%.2f %%) :: %.3f ms / frame (%d calls)\n",i, profileIterator->Get_Current_Name(), fraction,(current_total_time / (double)frames_since_reset),profileIterator->Get_Current_Total_Calls());
00652                 totalTime += current_total_time;
00653                 //recurse into children
00654         }
00655 
00656         if (parent_time < accumulated_time)
00657         {
00658                 //printf("what's wrong\n");
00659         }
00660         for (i=0;i<spacing;i++) printf(".");
00661         printf("%s (%.3f %%) :: %.3f ms\n", "Unaccounted:",parent_time > SIMD_EPSILON ? ((parent_time - accumulated_time) / parent_time) * 100 : 0.f, parent_time - accumulated_time);
00662 
00663         for (i=0;i<numChildren;i++)
00664         {
00665                 profileIterator->Enter_Child(i);
00666                 dumpRecursive(profileIterator,spacing+3);
00667                 profileIterator->Enter_Parent();
00668         }
00669 }
00670 
00671 
00672 
00673 void    CProfileManager::dumpAll()
00674 {
00675         CProfileIterator* profileIterator = 0;
00676         profileIterator = CProfileManager::Get_Iterator();
00677 
00678         dumpRecursive(profileIterator,0);
00679 
00680         CProfileManager::Release_Iterator(profileIterator);
00681 }

00685 
00686 unsigned int btQuickprofGetCurrentThreadIndex2()
00687 {
00688 #if BT_THREADSAFE
00689     return btGetCurrentThreadIndex();
00690 #else // #if BT_THREADSAFE
00691         const unsigned int kNullIndex = ~0U;
00692 #ifdef _WIN32
00693     #if defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__MINGW64__)
00694         static __thread unsigned int sThreadIndex = kNullIndex;
00695     #else
00696         __declspec( thread ) static unsigned int sThreadIndex = kNullIndex;
00697     #endif
00698 #else
00699 #ifdef __APPLE__
00700         #if TARGET_OS_IPHONE
00701                 unsigned int sThreadIndex = 0;
00702                 return -1;
00703         #else
00704                 static __thread unsigned int sThreadIndex = kNullIndex;
00705         #endif
00706 #else//__APPLE__
00707 #if __linux__
00708         static __thread unsigned int sThreadIndex = kNullIndex;
00709 #else
00710         unsigned int sThreadIndex = 0;
00711         return -1;
00712 #endif
00713 #endif//__APPLE__
00714         
00715 #endif
00716         static int gThreadCounter=0;
00717 
00718         if ( sThreadIndex == kNullIndex )
00719         {
00720                 sThreadIndex = gThreadCounter++;
00721         }
00722         return sThreadIndex;
00723 #endif // #else // #if BT_THREADSAFE
00724 }

00731 {
00732         CProfileManager::Stop_Profile(); 
00733 }

00736 #else

00742 }

00748 
00749 static btEnterProfileZoneFunc* bts_enterFunc = btEnterProfileZoneDefault;
00750 static btLeaveProfileZoneFunc* bts_leaveFunc = btLeaveProfileZoneDefault;
00751 
00752 void btEnterProfileZone(const char* name)
00753 {
00754         (bts_enterFunc)(name);
00755 }
00756 void btLeaveProfileZone()
00757 {
00758         (bts_leaveFunc)();
00759 }
00760 
00761 btEnterProfileZoneFunc* btGetCurrentEnterProfileZoneFunc()
00762 {
00763         return bts_enterFunc ;
00764 }
00765 btLeaveProfileZoneFunc* btGetCurrentLeaveProfileZoneFunc()
00766 {
00767         return bts_leaveFunc;
00768 }
00769 
00770 
00771 void btSetCustomEnterProfileZoneFunc(btEnterProfileZoneFunc* enterFunc)
00772 {
00773         bts_enterFunc = enterFunc;
00774 }
00775 void btSetCustomLeaveProfileZoneFunc(btLeaveProfileZoneFunc* leaveFunc)
00776 {
00777         bts_leaveFunc = leaveFunc;
00778 }

00780 CProfileSample::CProfileSample( const char * name )
00781 { 
00782         btEnterProfileZone(name);
00783 }
00784 
00785 CProfileSample::~CProfileSample( void )                                 
00786 { 
00787         btLeaveProfileZone();
